name: stereospecifically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way where the result of a chemical reaction is controlled by the position of the atoms within the molecules (= a unit of a chemical substance made of a group of two or more atoms) involved in the reaction: A series of stereospecifically labelled polyunsaturated fatty acids was prepared by biosynthesis. The reactions take place stereospecifically in most cases, regardless of the type of reagent used.
More examplesFewer examplesThe enzyme always stereospecifically removes the same hydrogen atom.This reaction is stereospecifically inhibited by one of the chemicals, but not the other.
